text:

The following riddle will guide you to where you seek.

"In the garden of <u>stones</u>, where <u>virtues</u> align,
Children's play turns to <u>deeds</u> divine.
A <u>blossom</u> of <u>purity</u>, though not of the <u>earth</u>,
In this <u>sacred</u> act, you'll find its <u>worth</u>.

Count the number of <u>UNDERLINED</u> words in the riddle. Skip that many words on the English Information Panel to find the ingredient.

info: The Eight Auspicious Symbols (å…«å‰ç¥¥) include the Dharma Wheel â˜¸ (representing Buddha's teachings), the Lotus Flower ğŸª· (symbolizing purity), the Victory Banner âœŒï¸ğŸ»ğŸ³ï¸ (spiritual triumph), the Endless Knot ğŸª¢ (interconnectedness), the Treasure Vessel ğŸº (spiritual abundance), the Pair of Golden Fishes ğŸŸğŸŸ (freedom), the Parasol â˜‚ï¸ (protection), and the Conch Shell ğŸš (spreading the Dharma). Each symbol brings blessings, spiritual wisdom, and protection to practitioners. Spinning the Dharma Wheel â˜¸ï¸ is believed to accumulate merit, dispel negative energies, and spread Buddha's teachings. It fosters mindfulness and spiritual growth, helping individuals progress on the path to enlightenment.

Walk until you find where the images of food appear. Decipher the clues hidden in the descriptions, and piece together the letters to reveal your next move.
